content.body: AFAICT, https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/upgrade-insecure-requests/gen/iframe-blank-inherit.meta/upgrade/fetch.https.html tests that calling `document.open()` on the initial `about:blank` inherits `upgrade-insecure-requests` from the caller to the `open()`ed doc. I don't see this specified in either https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-upgrade-insecure-requests/ or https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#document-open-steps . What am I missing? (Also, Gecko tries to inherit CSP between steps 6 and 7, but evidently, it's not inheriting enough.)
